etymologies: Middle English: from Old French borbete, probably from borbe ‘mud, slime’

definitions: an elongated bottom-dwelling fish that is the only member of the cod family that lives in fresh water. It occurs in Eurasia and North America, but is almost extinct in Britain.
shortDefinitions: elongated bottom-dwelling fish that is only freshwater member of cod family, occurring in Eurasia and North America but extinct in Britain
